thread.section_title: JP Updates | Breaking News NYC, Jewish Political News & Updates
thread.title: JP Morning Read: October 20, 2015

author: jpupdates
title: JP Morning Read: October 20, 2015
text:
Share 
Violence in Israel 
(Does it Really Matter?) My cousin made me do it: Ahmed Manasra, the 13-year-old Palestinian boy that wounded two Israelis in the Pisgat Ze’ev section of Jerusalem last week, changed his story when questioned by authorities about his part in the assault his claims contradict his initial statements made to the authorities soon after his arrest, when he said that he and his cousin wanted to stab Jews in response to a perceived violation of the status quo on Temple Mount. [JPOST] 
Arabs attacking Jews: Over 100 years of excuses: Before the partition, before Israel, before the settlements, before the ‘occupation’, before the refugees, before Sharon walked onto Temple Mount, before the ‘wall’, before immigration, before Balfour and before even Zionism itself. In the beginning there was an Arab with a knife and he murdered a Jew, simply because he was a Jew.It is an absurd logic that attempts to blame Zionism for creating violence against Jews when Modern Zionism *only came about* because of relentless violence against Jews; both in Europe and in the Middle East. You cannot place the cart before the horse.Enough with the excuses. [UKMEDIAWATCH] Boy 13, wounded in Jerusalem stabbing, wakes up: The boy has even begun to communicate with medical personnel and family members, according to a statement by the hospital.The boy was one of two Israeli victims stabbed by Ahmed and Hassan Manasra, 13 and 15, respectively, on October 12.He was taken to the hospital in life-threatening condition, placed in an induced coma and connected to a respirator. [TIMESOFISRAEL] 

Jerusalem Graves Found Desecrated Amid Rampant Violence: According to the International Committee for the Preservation of Har Hazeisim (ICPHH), the Arabs used large boulders to crack the matzeivos and then filed some of the interior with garbage. The destroyed graves were just below the chelka of Gur, which had also suffered extensive desecrations just a few months ago. [JP] 
Hamas making efforts to carry out suicide attacks against Israel: Mahmoud al-Zahar, a senior figure in Hamas’ political bureau, told an Islamist-affiliated web site in Gaza that he was hopeful the current violence would escalate into “an armed intifada.”The Hamas leader said that it was incumbent on the Palestinians to use firearms and more deadly means “since this is what the Israeli side is doing.””Those who are coming out against an armed intifada are doing so out of personal interest and VIP status,” he said, taking a veiled verbal swipe at Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas. [JPOST] 
Chairman of House Foreign Affairs on Israeli Violence: ‘It Must Stop’: U.S. Rep. Ed Royce (R-CA), Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee announced on Monday that on Oct. 22, the committee will convene a hearing entitled, “Words Have Consequences: Palestinian Authority Incitement to Violence.” [JP] 
JP News Roundup 
Canadian Election Underway as Long Campaign Heads to Photo Finish: Prime Minister Stephen Harper, a Conservative who has held power for almost a decade, called the vote on Aug. 2 hoping that the more voters saw of Justin Trudeau the less they would like him. For many Canadians, the election was a referendum on Mr. Harper’s approach to government: [NYT] 
Recreational drones in the United States will soon have to be registered: For recreational drone pilots in the United States, the flight rules are clear: no higher than 400 feet, always within sight and nowhere near an airport without prior permission.But authorities admit they are currently powerless to clamp down on reckless behavior.“Finding the drone has not been as much of a problem as finding the person who was using the drone,” Foxx said. “The registration is designed to close that loophole.” [AFP] 
Twitter 
Bill de Blasio .The Western Wall reminds us of the power of faith and our shared hope for peace. Humbled to visit. 
Chaim Deutch: FREE flu shots will be available tomorrow October 20th at my district office w/ @MountSinaiNYC! Please see flyer. 
Chaskel Bennett : Great to see Congressman @dandonovan_ny ,at the @AIPAC Real Estate leaders event in NY today. cc @NYCGreenfield 
Jeff Leb: In between @UJAfedNY visits to Boro Park Sites, we enjoyed a delicious lunch at @BleuOn13, owned by Chaim Kornbluh. JP LOCAL 
Cuomo Praises Court Ruling to Uphold NY SAFE Act: “When we passed the SAFE Act, just days after the tragedies in Newtown and Webster, New York proved to the nation that it is possible to enact sensible gun control that coexists with the Second Amendment, [JP] 
City Council Bill Aims to Limit Number of Tour Buses in the City: The number of double-decker buses has ballooned over the past 10 years — in 2003, there were just 54, Chin’s office said.The goal of the bill is not to stifle the tourist industry, Chin’s office said, but to ensure the buses don’t become an overgrown problem for city residents. In September 2014, there were upwards of 299 registered tour buses in the city. [DNAINFO] 
The criminal probe of former Brooklyn District Attorney Charles Hynes is heating up: Almost a dozen investigators from the Brooklyn US Attorney’s Office, the state Attorney General’s Office, and both the city and state comptroller’s offices asked the ex-staffers whether Hynes’ neighborhood community relations offices were being used as de facto campaign outposts in the 2013 race, a source said. [NYP] 
The NY Post Gets It All Wrong: De Blasio’s ‘Vision Zero’ Works: New York Post report, the de Blasio administration was accused of “pandering” to the Orthodox Jewish vote in Williamsburg by issuing fewer traffic tickets in an effort to “keep them happy.”The accusation is even more questionable in light of the two Satmar sects in the area, in which one of the sects, led by Rabbi Zalmen Teitelbaum, did not even support de Blasio in the mayoral race the first time around, opting to shower City Comptroller Bill Thompson with support instead.So how does a police officer know which side of Satmar the driver belongs to? [JP] 
Whooping cough cases spike in Orthodox Jewish neighborhoods: A wave of whooping cough has hit the Orthodox Jewish Brooklyn neighborhoods of Crown Heights, Williamsburg and Borough Park, city health officials said Monday.A total of 109 cases of pertussis, or whooping cough, were reported over the past year in the three neighborhoods, with an increase in cases over the past four months, the Health Department said.Health officials are urging doctors to recall patients who are not up to date with vaccines so they can provide prompt antibiotic treatment to affected patients. [NYP] 
Phil Goldfeder Endorses Nassau County Legislator Santino, Kopel for Re-Election :The rising star in the Democratic party, represents the Rockaways — which is located immediately adjacent to Hempstead Town — and remains instrumentally active in Jewish politics. Goldfeder made the announcement at a press conference at Traditions Eatery in the Five Towns on Sunday [JP] TIP ME: Something going on & our readers should know about ? Let us know Email: info@jpupdates.com
